TopicTitle: Video Wednesday: A Visit From The Kraken

Articles.Content: <figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_ns9l82Ykcl1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><figure data-url="https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DNhk1BPQxoHE" data-orig-height="304" data-orig-width="540" data-provider="youtube" class="tmblr-embed tmblr-full"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Nhk1BPQxoHE?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="304" width="540"></iframe></figure><p>Since version 1.0 was released you can easily change the physics in the game, simply by editing a plain text configuration file. Of course, it’s only a matter of time before someone properly abuses this system and that’s exactly what Hazard-ish did in this video, with catastrophic results.</p><p>Square orbits, anyone?</p>

It took you like 2 months to find this SQUAD?! GG SQUAD, GG

But really it's a good video.

Wow. that's actually quite funny... now time to destroy more stuff.

- - - Updated - - -

And yes SQUAD, how about merging Minecraft with KSP (It'll be a complete fun time, with the ability to chip away planets with explosions...).

Although, how in the heck would Square orbits even mechanic correctly?

Funny enough, I was able to reproduce this by setting the aero settings to the same as in his video, with the side effect of having to restart the game to get the universe besides the skybox to show up again. No kraken attack, though.
I think Danny has a rival
